item.title: Bernal cloas , Lister walk,, 10th January
item.description:
All public car park becoming junk yard been reporting issues but still waiting, can't even park my own car , someone making junk yard all around, all cars are sorn some off them in poor condition, no mot , can you please remove them .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bernal Close, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mountain of dog poo, 10th January
item.description:
Continuous problem with dog fouling that accumulates and is rarely cleaned away. Currently a mini mountain of poo amassing by sign and electrical box.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravenscroft Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Regent’s Park Rd near Rothwell/St George’s, 10th January
item.description:
What is the plan for the areas where the road has been narrowed? The paving has been widened, which is a positive improvement, but the remaining sections have been left unfinished and are now an eyesore. These areas need to be properly filled and, ideally, completed with new trees or other planting. Is there a plan to finish this work, or will these sections be left in their current condition indefinitely.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 120, Regent's Park Road, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 2 Cavendish Road on the pavement, 10th January
item.description:
Soaked clothes, other rubbish /see on photos/. I’ve tried to clean it up because it’s very upsetting to see when passing by but it’s just too filthy and too much. This’s such a hot spot to dump rubbish. I see it nearly daily. It’s such a shame to spoil an otherwise lovely road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cavendish Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: All out - three or more street lights in a row

item.title: Bollard near no 1 Chalcot Square, 10th January
item.description:
The bollard here has been struck by a vehicle again, causing the pavement to lift. This is a safety concern and needs to be addressed. Please ensure the bollard is replaced and that the new installation matches the size and height of the surrounding bollards. The previous repair used a shorter bollard, which was noticeably inconsistent with the others.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Chalcot Crescent, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
